pre_caption: This is a full shot of a non-human subject underwater, captured from a high angle. Initially, a long gantry structure spans the top of the frame in the middle ground, with a large piece of wreckage suspended centrally below it, also in the middle ground. A large section of the wreckage then detaches from the center and falls downwards, moving from the middle ground toward the background. As it falls, the camera tilts down and gradually zooms in to track the descending piece, causing the gantry and the remaining wreckage to exit the frame from the top. The shot ends as a full shot of the detached, spider-like fragment, which now occupies the center of the frame in the middle ground as it tumbles downwards. The seabed, previously out of view, enters the frame from the bottom and occupies the background, while small glowing particles drift in the foreground and middle ground.
